oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of Sgt. William H. White, Co. H, 14th Va. Inf. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sgt. White was from Meadsville, Halifax County, Va. and his father was a tobacco farmer. The soldier served in Co. H, 14th Va. Inf. Regt., CSA and was captured near Petersburg, Va. May 10, 1864. Paroled and exchanged, he received a furlough for 30 days on March 9, 1865 from a Richmond Hospital. He survived the war and moved to Gibson County, Tennessee by 1870. He is buried in Eldad Cemetery Baptist Church in Gibson County, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: White, William H.
